Key Match Events: Travis d’Arnaud logged an RBI single in the four-run 10th inning
Michael Harris II hit a drive to right-center that center fielder Austin Martin couldn’t catch up to at the wall
Matt Olson followed with a chopper to second, and Kelenic slid home well ahead of second baseman Edouard Julien’s throw, which was too high for catcher Ryan Jeffers to attempt a tag
The Braves tacked on three more runs from there with d’Arnaud’s RBI single and a two-run double by Ramón Laureano
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Brian Snitker said, 'That’s a good win. It was going to be a costly loss, quite honestly. Now, it’s a good win.'

Travis d’Arnaud said, 'We knew we were getting some heat, and were able to fight off the good offspeed pitches, too. Just competitive at-bats throughout. I think everybody felt bad that we gave up the lead and wanted to make sure we ended with a win.'
Marcell Ozuna said, 'He’s a clutch hitter. Every time he’s got the situation in that spot, he’ll do something. He’ll do some damage.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Braves blew a late four-run lead, but rallied for four more runs in the 10th inning and held on to beat the Twins, 8-6.
Raisel Iglesias turned his first blown save since May 3 into a victory by pitching a 1-2-3 ninth inning.
Atlanta now has four extra-inning wins in the month of August.
